greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of k such that phi(k) divides phi(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2048 (computed with the help of b-file of A057826 provided by T. D. Noe)
formula: For all n, a(n) >= A066412(n). - _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 17 2017
program: ;; A naive implementation requiring precomputed A057826:

(define (A071181 n) (if (<= n 2) 2 (let ((ph (A000010 n))) (let loop ((k (A057826 (/ ph 2))) (s 0)) (if (zero? k) s (loop (- k 1) (+ s (if (zero? (modulo ph (A000010 k))) 1 0)))))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 18 2017
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Jun 10 2002
